title: B. Advanced usage
text: default, every method manipulating values DTSg object creates deep clone (copy) beforehand. behaviour can overridden setting clone argument respective method FALSE. Globally, deep cloning can controlled help DTSgClone option: can see, cloning set FALSE, object altered place, .e. assignment new reassignment existing variable necessary order make changes stick. due R6 nature DTSg objects.
code: TS$alter("2007-01-01", "2008-12-31") # `TS` was deep cloned before shortening it, hence its end date is still in the # year 2012 TS #> Values: #>        .dateTime   flow #>           <POSc>  <num> #>    1: 2007-01-01  9.540 #>    2: 2007-01-02  9.285 #>    3: 2007-01-03  8.940 #>    4: 2007-01-04  8.745 #>    5: 2007-01-05  8.490 #>   ---                   #> 2188: 2012-12-27 26.685 #> 2189: 2012-12-28 28.050 #> 2190: 2012-12-29 23.580 #> 2191: 2012-12-30 18.840 #> 2192: 2012-12-31 17.250 #>  #> Aggregated:     FALSE #> Regular:        TRUE #> Periodicity:    Time difference of 1 days #> Missing values: explicit #> Time zone:      UTC #> Timestamps:     2192  options(DTSgClone = FALSE) getOption("DTSgClone") #> [1] FALSE # `TS` was modified in place this time, hence its end date is in the year 2008 # now TS$alter("2007-01-01", "2008-12-31") TS #> Values: #>       .dateTime   flow #>          <POSc>  <num> #>   1: 2007-01-01  9.540 #>   2: 2007-01-02  9.285 #>   3: 2007-01-03  8.940 #>   4: 2007-01-04  8.745 #>   5: 2007-01-05  8.490 #>  ---                   #> 727: 2008-12-27 18.180 #> 728: 2008-12-28 16.575 #> 729: 2008-12-29 13.695 #> 730: 2008-12-30 12.540 #> 731: 2008-12-31 11.940 #>  #> Aggregated:     FALSE #> Regular:        TRUE #> Periodicity:    Time difference of 1 days #> Missing values: explicit #> Time zone:      UTC #> Timestamps:     731

title: B. Advanced usage
text: Using reference semantics can result undesired behaviour. Merely assigning variable representing DTSg object new variable result copy object. Instead, variables reference access data hood, .e. changing one also affect . case want “real” copy DTSg object, use clone() method deep argument set TRUE (consistency R6 package default FALSE):
code: TSc <- TS$clone(deep = TRUE) # or 'clone(TS, deep = TRUE)'

title: B. Advanced usage
text: Especially combination reference semantics, chaining piping can fast comfortable way apply several object manipulations row. chaining works combination R6 interface, piping exclusive feature S3 interface. Let’s start chaining: piping, make sure R 4.1.0 later installed order access R’s native pipe operator |> (alternatively, can achieved forward-pipe operator %>% magrittr package):
code: TS <- DTSg$   new(flow)$   alter("2007-01-01", "2008-12-31")$   colapply(interpolateLinear)$   aggregate(byYm____, mean) TS #> Values: #>      .dateTime      flow #>         <POSc>     <num> #>  1: 2007-01-01 25.281290 #>  2: 2007-02-01 14.496964 #>  3: 2007-03-01 12.889839 #>  4: 2007-04-01 12.470500 #>  5: 2007-05-01  9.233226 #> ---                      #> 20: 2008-08-01 12.641129 #> 21: 2008-09-01 13.710500 #> 22: 2008-10-01 10.626774 #> 23: 2008-11-01  8.902000 #> 24: 2008-12-01 16.435645 #>  #> Aggregated:     TRUE #> Regular:        FALSE #> Periodicity:    1 months #> Min lag:        Time difference of 28 days #> Max lag:        Time difference of 31 days #> Missing values: explicit #> Time zone:      UTC #> Timestamps:     24 TS <- new("DTSg", flow) |>   alter("2007-01-01", "2008-12-31") |>   colapply(interpolateLinear) |>   aggregate(byYm____, mean) TS #> Values: #>      .dateTime      flow #>         <POSc>     <num> #>  1: 2007-01-01 25.281290 #>  2: 2007-02-01 14.496964 #>  3: 2007-03-01 12.889839 #>  4: 2007-04-01 12.470500 #>  5: 2007-05-01  9.233226 #> ---                      #> 20: 2008-08-01 12.641129 #> 21: 2008-09-01 13.710500 #> 22: 2008-10-01 10.626774 #> 23: 2008-11-01  8.902000 #> 24: 2008-12-01 16.435645 #>  #> Aggregated:     TRUE #> Regular:        FALSE #> Periodicity:    1 months #> Min lag:        Time difference of 28 days #> Max lag:        Time difference of 31 days #> Missing values: explicit #> Time zone:      UTC #> Timestamps:     24

title: B. Advanced usage
text: extension reference semantics existing DTSg objects reference semantics object creation. behaviour can triggered help swallow argument new() method. set TRUE, data.table provided values argument “swallowed” DTSg object, .e. copy made references removed global (global) environment upon successful object creation: opposite swallowing called dropping. term refers querying values DTSg object reference removing references original DTSg object global (global) environment time:
code: library(data.table)  DT <- copy(flow) ls(pattern = "^DT$") #> [1] "DT" TS <- DTSg$new(DT, swallow = TRUE) ls(pattern = "^DT$") #> character(0) TS <- DTSg$new(flow) ls(pattern = "^TS$") #> [1] "TS" DT <- TS$values(drop = TRUE) ls(pattern = "^TS$") #> character(0)

title: B. Advanced usage
text: Sometimes need may arise access column one currently processed function within colapply() method. can accomplished following way: Please refer help pages details.
code: # add a new column recording if a certain value is missing or not before # carrying out a linear interpolation TS <- DTSg$new(flow) TS$summary() #>       flow         #>  Min.   :  4.995   #>  1st Qu.:  8.085   #>  Median : 11.325   #>  Mean   : 16.197   #>  3rd Qu.: 18.375   #>  Max.   :290.715   #>  NA's   :23 TS$   colapply(     function(x, ...) is.na(x),     resultCols = "missing"   )$   colapply(interpolateLinear)$   summary() #>       flow          missing        #>  Min.   :  4.995   Mode :logical   #>  1st Qu.:  8.126   FALSE:2169      #>  Median : 11.408   TRUE :23        #>  Mean   : 16.212                   #>  3rd Qu.: 18.439                   #>  Max.   :290.715  # undo the linear interpolation (requires additional access to the previously # created column named "missing", which can be carried out with the help of the # `getCol` method or its shortcut, the `[` operator, and the freely chosen `y` # argument) TS$   colapply(     function(x, y, ...) ifelse(y, NA, x),     y = TS$getCol("missing") # or 'y = TS["missing"]'   )$   summary() #>       flow          missing        #>  Min.   :  4.995   Mode :logical   #>  1st Qu.:  8.085   FALSE:2169      #>  Median : 11.325   TRUE :23        #>  Mean   : 16.197                   #>  3rd Qu.: 18.375                   #>  Max.   :290.715                   #>  NA's   :23

Generally, similar anyway. R6 interface always object first method selected help $ operator, instance, x$cols(), S3 interface always method first object first argument, instance, cols(x). exception new method. title: DTSg class — DTSg
code: new(Class, values, ID = "", parameter = "", unit = "", variant = "",   aggregated = FALSE, fast = getOption("DTSgFast"), swallow = FALSE,   na.status = getOption("DTSgNA.status"), funbyApproach =   getOption("DTSgFunbyApproach"))

title: DTSg class — DTSg
text: Class character string. Must "DTSg" order create DTSg object. Otherwise different object may may created (S4 constructor ). values data.frame object inherited class data.frame, e.g. data.table::data.table. first column must class POSIXct coercible . serves object's time index renamed .dateTime. ID character string specifying ID (name) time series data object. parameter character string specifying parameter name time series data. unit character string specifying unit time series data. variant character string specifying metadata time series, instance, "min" point time series lower bound measurements. aggregated logical specifying timestamps series interpreted: snap-shots (FALSE) periods subsequent timestamps (TRUE). fast logical specifying rows (FALSE) first 1000 rows (TRUE) shall used check object's integrity automatic detection time series' periodicity. swallow logical specifying object provided values argument shall “swallowed” DTSg object, .e. copy data shall made. generally resource efficient, works provided object data.table::data.table. warned, however, creation DTSg object fails reason, first column provided data.table::data.table might coerced POSIXct keyed (see data.table::setkey information). Furthermore, references “swallowed” data.table::data.table global (global) environment removed upon successful creation DTSg object. na.status character string. Either "explicit", makes missing timestamps explicit according recognised periodicity, "implicit", removes timestamps missing values value columns, "undecided" action. Please note DTSg objects work best explicitly missing values. funbyApproach character string specifying default flavour TALFs used created DTSg object. Either "timechange", utilises timechange::time_floor, "base", utilises .POSIXct, "fasttime", utilises fasttime::fastPOSIXct, "RcppCCTZ", utilises RcppCCTZ::parseDatetime main function transforming timestamps. Custom approaches user defined temporal aggregation level functions also possible.

text: Due POSIXct nature .dateTime column, sub-second accuracy, issues limitations apply DTSg objects. order prevent least possible precision issues, lags subsequent timestamps rounded microseconds integrity checks. corresponds maximum value allowed options("digits.secs"). consequence, time series sub-second accuracy higher microsecond never work.

title: DTSg class — DTSg
text: DTSg object following fields properties often called. implemented called active bindings, means can accessed actively set help $ operator, instance, x$ID gets value ID field x$ID <- "River Flow" sets value. Please note fields always modified place, .e. deep clone (copy) object made beforehand. See clone information. fields read-though: aggregated: aggregated argument. fast: fast argument. funbyApproach: funbyApproach argument. ID: ID argument. used title plots. na.status: na.status argument. set, missing values object expanded collapsed accordingly. parameter: parameter argument. used label primary axis plots. periodicity: difftime object regular character string irregular DTSg object describing periodicity containing "unrecognised" case detected. set, periodicity time series changed specified. See argument alter information. regular: logical signalling lags seconds subsequent timestamps (TRUE) different (FALSE). , instance, monthly time series considered irregular sense (read-). timestamps: integer showing total number timestamps time series (read-). timezone: character string showing time zone time series. set, series converted specified time zone. names OlsonNames accepted. unit: unit argument. added label primary axis plots parameter field set. variant: variant argument. added label primary axis plots parameter field set. parameter, unit variant fields especially useful time series single variable. time series multiple variables differing units functionality units package may pose viable alternative.

title: DTSg class — DTSg
text: behaviour DTSg objects can customised help following option. See options information: DTSgClone: logical specifying DTSg objects , default, modified place (FALSE) deep clone (copy) shall made beforehand (TRUE) (package's default TRUE). DTSgDeprecatedWarnings: logical specifying warnings displayed calling deprecated features (package's default TRUE). DTSgFast: Default value fast argument (package's default FALSE). DTSgFunbyApproach: Default value funbyApproach argument (package's default "timechange"). DTSgNA.status: Default value na.status argument  (package's default "explicit").

title: Temporal Aggregation Level Functions (TALFs) — TALFs
text: functions return POSIXct vector timestamps corresponding function's temporal aggregation level.

title: Temporal Aggregation Level Functions (TALFs) — TALFs
text: two families temporal aggregation level functions. one family truncates timestamps (truncating family), extracts certain part (extracting family). family comes four flavours: first relies solely base R, second utilises fasttime::fastPOSIXct fasttime, third RcppCCTZ::parseDatetime RcppCCTZ fourth timechange::time_floor timechange. timechange flavour generally fastest families functions time zones. Second best option extracting family functions generally fasttime flavour, , however, works UTC equivalent well Etc/GMT time zones (execute grep("^(Etc/)?(UTC|UCT|Universal|Zulu)$|^(Etc/)?(GMT(\\+|-)?0?|Greenwich)$", OlsonNames(), ignore.case = TRUE, value = TRUE) full list supported time zones) limited timestamps years 1970 2199. time zones UTC equivalent RcppCCTZ flavour generally second best option. Use funbyApproach argument respective calling method order specify utilised flavour. truncating family sets timestamps lowest possible point time corresponding temporal aggregation level: byY_____ truncates years,    e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-01-01 00:00:00.0 byYQ____ truncates quarters, e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-10-01 00:00:00.0 byYm____ truncates months,   e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-11-01 00:00:00.0 byYmd___ truncates days,     e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-11-11 00:00:00.0 byYmdH__ truncates hours,    e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-11-11 11:00:00.0 byYmdHM_ truncates minutes,  e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-11-11 11:11:00.0 byYmdHMS truncates seconds,  e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2000-11-11 11:11:11.0 convention, extracting family sets year 2199 extracts certain part timestamps: by______ extracts nothing,      .e.          timestamps become  2199-01-01 00:00:00.0 by_Q____ extracts quarters, e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2199-10-01 00:00:00.0 by_m____ extracts months,   e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2199-11-01 00:00:00.0 by___H__ extracts hours,    e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2199-01-01 11:00:00.0 by____M_ extracts minutes,  e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2199-01-01 00:11:00.0 by_____S extracts seconds,  e.g. 2000-11-11 11:11:11.1 becomes 2199-01-01 00:00:11.0

title: Aggregate values — aggregate.DTSg
text: User defined temporal aggregation level functions return POSIXct vector length time series accept two arguments: POSIXct vector first list helper data second. default elements list follows: timezone: timezone field. ignoreDST: ignoreDST argument. periodicity: periodicity field. na.status: na.status field. multiplier: multiplier argument. funbyApproach: funbyApproach argument. assertion: logical specifying TALF called assertion. additional element specified funbyHelpers argument appended end default list. case funbyHelpers contains ignoreDST, multiplier funbyApproach element, takes precedence respective method argument. timezone, periodicity na.status elements rejected, always taken directly object. temporal aggregation level certain TALFs can adjusted help multiplier argument. multiplier 10, example, makes byY_____ aggregate decades instead years. Another example multiplier 6 provided by_m____. function aggregates months first months second half years instead months years separately. feature supported following TALFs package: byY_____ byYm____ byYmdH__ (UTC equivalent well Etc/GMT time zones ) byYmdHM_ byYmdHMS by_m____ by___H__ (UTC equivalent well Etc/GMT time zones ) by____M_ by_____S

code: # S3 method for class 'DTSg' rollapply(   x,   fun,   ...,   cols = self$cols(class = "numeric")[1L],   before = 1L,   after = before,   weights = "inverseDistance",   parameters = list(power = 1),   resultCols = NULL,   suffix = NULL,   helpers = TRUE,   memoryOverCPU = TRUE,   clone = getOption("DTSgClone") )

title: Rolling window function — rollapply.DTSg
text: x DTSg object (S3 method ). fun function. return value must length one. ... arguments passed fun. cols character vector specifying columns whose rolling window fun shall applied . Another possibility character string containing either comma separated column names, example, "x,y,z", start end column separated colon, example, "x:z". integerish value specifying size window time steps “center” rolling window. integerish value specifying size window time steps “center” rolling window. weights character string specifying method applied calculate weights handed fun. useful functions like weighted.mean. See corresponding section information. parameters list specifying parameters weight calculation method. See corresponding section information. resultCols optional character vector length cols specifying column names return values fun. Another possibility character string containing comma separated column names, example, "x,y,z". Non-existing columns added existing columns overwritten. Columns matched element-wise cols resultCols. suffix optional character string. return values fun added new columns names consisting columns specified cols suffix. Existing columns never overwritten. used resultCols specified. helpers logical specifying helper data shall handed fun. See corresponding section information. memoryOverCPU logical specifying memory usage shall preferred CPU usage method call. former generally faster smaller windows shorter time series, latter bigger windows longer time series might even one works depending available hardware. clone logical specifying object shall modified place deep clone (copy) shall made beforehand.

title: Rolling window function — rollapply.DTSg
text: Returns DTSg object.

title: Rolling window function — rollapply.DTSg
text: Currently, one method calculate weights supported: "inverseDistance". distance \(d\) “center” one time step away “center” adds one . , example, distance timestamp three steps away “center” four. Additionally, calculation weights accepts power parameter \(p\) named element list provided parameters argument: \(\frac{1}{d^p}\).

title: Rolling window function — rollapply.DTSg
text: addition ... argument, method optionally hands weights numeric vector (w argument) list argument helper data called .helpers fun. list contains following elements: : argument. : argument. windowSize: Size rolling window (+ 1L + ). centerIndex: Index “center” rolling window (+ 1L).

title: Rollback of months — rollback
text: Generating regular sequences time help seq.POSIXt can undesirable effects. function “first advances month without changing day: results invalid day month, counted forward next month”. Monthly yearly sequences starting end month 30 31 days (29 case leap year) therefore always fall end shorter months. rollback fixes counting days affected months backwards .

text: Returns POSIXct vector.

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: Filters rows /selects columns DTSg object.

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
code: # S3 method for class 'DTSg' subset(   x,   i,   cols = self$cols(),   funby = NULL,   ignoreDST = FALSE,   na.status = "implicit",   clone = getOption("DTSgClone"),   multiplier = 1L,   funbyHelpers = NULL,   funbyApproach = self$funbyApproach,   ... )

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: x DTSg object (S3 method ). integerish vector indexing rows (positive numbers pick negative numbers omit rows) filter expression accepted argument data.table::data.table. Filter expressions can contain special symbol .N. cols character vector specifying columns select. Another possibility character string containing either comma separated column names, example, "x,y,z", start end column separated colon, example, "x:z". .dateTime column always selected part . funby One temporal aggregation level functions described TALFs user defined temporal aggregation level function. Can used , instance, select last two observations certain temporal level. See corresponding section examples information. ignoreDST logical specifying day saving time shall ignored funby. See corresponding section information. na.status character string. Either "explicit", makes missing timestamps explicit according recognised periodicity, "implicit", removes timestamps missing values value columns. See corresponding section information. clone logical specifying object shall modified place deep clone (copy) shall made beforehand. multiplier positive integerish value “multiplying” temporal aggregation level certain TALFs. See corresponding section information. funbyHelpers optional list helper data passed funby. See corresponding section information. funbyApproach character string specifying flavour applied temporal aggregation level function. Either "timechange", utilises timechange::time_floor, "base", utilises .POSIXct, "fasttime", utilises fasttime::fastPOSIXct, "RcppCCTZ", utilises RcppCCTZ::parseDatetime main function transforming timestamps. ... used (S3 method ).

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: Returns DTSg object.

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: Please note filtering rows making missing timestamps explicit equals setting values timestamps missing. default value na.status therefore "implicit". simply filter consecutive range DTSg object leaving na.status untouched, alter probably better choice.

what: User defined TALFs, TALFs helper data and multiplier
title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: User defined temporal aggregation level functions return POSIXct vector length time series accept two arguments: POSIXct vector first list helper data second. default elements list follows: timezone: timezone field. ignoreDST: ignoreDST argument. periodicity: periodicity field. na.status: na.status field. multiplier: multiplier argument. funbyApproach: funbyApproach argument. assertion: logical specifying TALF called assertion. additional element specified funbyHelpers argument appended end default list. case funbyHelpers contains ignoreDST, multiplier funbyApproach element, takes precedence respective method argument. timezone, periodicity na.status elements rejected, always taken directly object. temporal aggregation level certain TALFs can adjusted help multiplier argument. multiplier 10, example, makes byY_____ aggregate decades instead years. Another example multiplier 6 provided by_m____. function aggregates months first months second half years instead months years separately. feature supported following TALFs package: byY_____ byYm____ byYmdH__ (UTC equivalent well Etc/GMT time zones ) byYmdHM_ byYmdHMS by_m____ by___H__ (UTC equivalent well Etc/GMT time zones ) by____M_ by_____S

title: Subset time series data — subset.DTSg
text: ignoreDST tells temporal aggregation level function supposed ignore day saving time transforming timestamps. can desired feature time series strictly following position sun hydrological time series. ensures diurnal variations preserved means intervals “correct” length, however, possible limitation might day saving time shift estimated, assumed one hour long warning issued. feature requires periodicity time series recognised supported following TALFs package: byY_____ byYQ____ byYm____ byYmd___ by_Q____ by_m____ by___H__

See corresponding section information. drop logical specifying object references shall removed global (global) environment successfully returning values. feature allows resource efficient destruction DTSg object preserving values. class character string specifying class returned values. "data.frame" works either copy values returned object dropped. ... used (S3 method ).

title: Get values — values.DTSg
text: reference values DTSg object can used modify place. includes .dateTime column, serves object's time index. Modifying column can therefore endanger object's integrity. case needs ever arise, refresh called immediately afterwards order check object's integrity.

title: DTSg v2.0.0.9000
text: day saving time shift ignoreDST argument aggregate(), colapply() subset() methods now attempted estimated invariably assumed one hour long. time zones now considered UTC equivalent (execute grep("^(Etc/)?(UTC|UCT|Universal|Zulu)$|^(Etc/)?(GMT(\\+|-)?0?|Greenwich)$", OlsonNames(), ignore.case = TRUE, value = TRUE) full list). Updated package’s pkgdown website Bootstrap 5. Slightly improved documentation. Minor internal code improvements, require R ≥ 4.0.0.

title: DTSg v2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-20 Added "timechange" funbyApproach utilising timechange::time_floor() main function transforming timestamps. new approach generally way faster existing ones families TALFs time zones, hence new package’s default. Sped byY_____() byYm____() TALFs "base" funbyApproach. print() method print values’ key anymore, used data.table’s default v1.15.0. time zone DTSg object UTC equivalent. ignoreDST argument TRUE. single column missing values aggregated. possible .n column now contains 0 instead NA case values certain temporal aggregation level missing. stripping missing values within summary functions now depends value possible na.rm argument. Fixed support data.table’s GForce optimisation fun argument aggregate() method provided character vector specifying summary functions. Please note column order resulting DTSg object now different due fix. Fixed setCols() method R6 alias set() anxious removing value columns. longer possible use deprecated byFasttime*() TALFs. Please use "fasttime" even better new "timechange" funbyApproach now . Removed magrittr suggested packages list (vignettes now use R’s native pipe operator). Slightly improved documentation. Improved tests. Major internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v1.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-27 Ceased use legacy time zone symlinks tests. Bumped minimum tested R version 4.0.2 4.2.3 using corresponding Posit public package manager snapshot. Slightly improved documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v1.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-08 Column names can often now additionally specified character string containing either comma separated column names, example, "x,y,z", start end column separated colon, example, "x:z". Fixed bug interpolateLinear() function causing partial last observation carried forward behaviour roll argument specified smaller size gap interpolated. Fixed bug interpolateLinear() function causing partial interpolation certain cases roll argument specified smaller size gap interpolated. Slightly improved documentation.

title: DTSg v1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-02 Added funbyApproach argument new(), aggregate(), colapply() subset() methods: allows specifying flavour applied temporal aggregation level functions (either "base" utilising .POSIXct() "fasttime" utilising fasttime::fastPOSIXct() "RcppCCTZ" utilising RcppCCTZ::parseDatetime() main function transforming timestamps). Custom approaches user defined TALFs also possible. Please note byFasttime* versions TALFs now deprecated. Use argument now instead. Added funbyApproach also list helper data (funbyHelpers argument) passed TALFs. Added funbyApproach field reflecting individual funbyApproach DTSg object (can also actively set order change utilised approach). Added undocumented names() method exclusively R6 interface acting alias cols() method. Added mode typeof arguments cols() method: allows getting column names certain mode() /typeof(). can especially handy making use units package. Added DTSgFast, DTSgFunbyApproach DTSgNA.status options providing default values fast, funbyApproach na.status arguments new() method. Added DTSgDeprecatedWarnings option: allows disabling warnings deprecated features. Greatly sped by______() byFasttime______() TALFs. longer possible use deprecated value "" class argument cols() method order get column names. Use default value NULL instead . "" treated filter classes type now . Added example setCols() method showing set measurement units help units package. Added example documentation colapply() method showing calculate running correlations help runner package. Bumped minimum tested R version 3.5.2 4.0.2 using corresponding MRAN repository snapshot. Slightly improved documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.8.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-27 Added “special class” called ".numerary" available class argument cols() method: allows querying names integer numeric columns one go. Added undocumented raggregate(), rbind(), set() setnames() methods exclusively R6 interface acting aliases rowaggregate(), rowbind(), setCols() setColNames() methods. print() method now truncates number printed rows values aggressively. Created pkgdown website. Improved vignettes documentation.

title: DTSg v0.7.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-30 Fixed error “Error prettyNum(.Internal(format(x, trim, digits, nsmall, width, 3L, : invalid value 0 ‘digits’ argument” related tests upcoming R 4.2.0. Slightly improved documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-05 Added rowaggregate() method: allows applying summary functions row-wise DTSg object. Added rowbind() method: allows combining rows DTSg object. Added setColNames() method: allows renaming columns DTSg object. Added multiplier funbyHelpers arguments aggregate(), colapply() subset() methods: allows adjusting temporal aggregation level TALFs passing user defined helper data TALFs. Added multiplier also list helper data passed TALFs. Added helpers argument colapply() rollapply() methods: controls helper data passed applied function (makes occasionally needed anonymous function wrappers obsolete, e.g. x$colapply(fun = function(x, ...) {cumsum(x)}, funby = byYm____) can now written x$colapply(fun = cumsum, helpers = FALSE, funby = byYm____)). TALFs based fasttime package now also support time zones equivalent UTC (execute grep("^(Etc/)?(UCT|UTC)$|^(Etc/)?GMT(\\+|-)?0?$", OlsonNames(), ignore.case = TRUE, value = TRUE) full list supported time zones). Fixed DTSg object one timestamp set name .dateTime column expected. Improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-12 Added subset() method: allows filtering rows /selecting columns DTSg object. Added setCols() method: allows setting values columns , adding columns /removing columns DTSg object. Added [ extract operator: acts shortcut getCol() method. Added examples documentation colapply() method showing calculate moving averages help runner package instead rollapply() method. aggregate() method can benefit data.table’s GForce optimisation now fun argument provided character vector specifying summary functions. Greatly sped nas() method. Temporal aggregation level functions supplied funby argument colapply() method forced return POSIXct timestamp longer. , however, forced return atomic mode (goes subset() method). getCol() method now capable also querying .dateTime column. R6Method argument S3WrapperGenerator() function now also takes public method R6ClassGenerator function expression. Fixed missing values made explicit call merge() method despite "explicit" na.status cases. Fixed getCol() method tried query numeric columns instead first one default. Improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-09 Added getCol() method: allows querying values single column DTSg object. Added funby ignoreDST arguments colapply() method: allows applying functions like cumsum() certain temporal level. Added na.status argument new() alter() methods: allows making missing values either "explicit" (default) "implicit" leaving alone via "undecided". Added na.status field reflecting status missing values (can also actively set). Added na.status also list helper data passed temporal aggregation level functions. funby argument aggregate() method now also accepts named list functions: allows calculating several summary statistics . periodicity field can now actively set order change periodicity time series. timezone field can now actively set order convert time zone series. Fixed DTSg object one timestamp accepted missing value .dateTime column. Improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-08 Fixed error “Error .POSIXct.numeric(e) : ‘origin’ must supplied” related rollback() function upcoming R 4.1.0. Slightly improved vignettes. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-28 Added memoryOverCPU argument rollapply() method: allows preferring CPU memory usage makes method flexible terms resource consumption. Settings option DTSgClone e.g. .RProfile now respected overwritten TRUE package loaded. Fixed useless coercion POSIXct .dateTime columns POSIXct upon object creation case contained least one missing value. Switched unit testing framework tinytest instead testthat package. Slightly improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-08 Added resultCols suffix arguments colapply() rollapply() methods: allows adding return values applied functions new columns instead replacing existing ones. class argument cols() method now accepts character vector class names. Changed default value class argument cols() method "" NULL, however, backward compatibility "" can still used result, eventually treated filter classes type . Added pattern ... arguments cols() method: allows searching column names. Switched argument check functions checkmate package instead assertive.base, assertive.numbers, assertive.sets assertive.types packages. Slightly improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-20 Fixed error “Unsupported type passed argument ‘data’.” related dygraphs package least releases R ≤ 3.5.3.

title: DTSg v0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-14 Added swallow argument new() method: allows resource efficient object creation. Added drop argument values() method: allows resource efficient destruction DTSg object preserving values. Added class argument values() method: can used return values DTSg object data.frame instead data.table. alter() method linked new() methods now way resource efficient cases. Added timestamps field providing total number timestamps. print() method now omits empty metadata fields. Added means measure code coverage help covr package. Removed xts suggested packages list (already comes along dygraphs package). Slightly improved vignettes documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: DTSg v0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-29 Slightly improved vignettes documentation.

title: DTSg v0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-13 First release.
